content.text: State what is meant by a line of force in a gravitational field
By reference to the pattern of the lines of gravitational force near to the surface of the Earth, explain why the acceleration of free fall near to the Earth's surface is approximately constant
Calculate the gravitational field strength at the Moon's surface
gravitational field strength = .........N kg\(^{-1}\)
A satellite is in a circular orbit about the Moon at a height of \(320 \text{km}\) above its surface
Calculate the time for the satellite to complete one orbit of the Moon
The Moon may be considered to be a uniform sphere that is isolated in space. It has radius \(1.74 \times 10^{3} \text{km}\) and mass \(7.35 \times 10^{22} \text{kg}\)
Determine the temperature of the gas
temperature = .........K
Use your answer in (a) to determine the new volume of the gas
volume = .........cmÂ³
Calculate the increase in internal energy of the gas. Explain your working
increase in internal energy = .........J
The average kinetic energy \(E_{\mathrm{K}}\) of a molecule of the gas is given by the expression
where \(k\) is the Boltzmann constant and \(T\) is the thermodynamic temperature
The gas is heated at constant pressure so that its temperature rises by 125K
Use your answer in **(b)(i)** to determine the external work done during the expansion of the gas
work done = .........J
Calculate the total thermal energy required to heat the gas in **(b)**
energy = .........J

A cylinder contains \(5.12 \text{mol}\) of an ideal gas at pressure of \(5.60 \times 10^5 \text{Pa}\) and volume \(3.80 \times 10^4 \text{cm}^3\)
A mass is undergoing simple harmonic motion with amplitude \(x_0\). The maximum velocity of the mass has magnitude \(v_0\)
On Fig. 3.1, show the variation with displacement \(x\) of the velocity \(v\) of the mass

The angle \(\theta\) between the direction of the current and the direction of the magnetic field is varied. The maximum force on the wire is \(F_0\)
On Fig. 3.2, show the variation with angle \(\theta\) of the force \(F\) on the wire for values of \(\theta\) between \(0^\circ\) and \(90^\circ\)

On the axes of Fig. 3.3, show quantitatively the variation with time \(t\) of the voltage \(V\) for one cycle of the varying voltage

the nucleus \(^{141}_{56}\mathrm{Ba}\) (label this point Ba),
the nucleus \(^{92}_{36}\mathrm{Kr}\) (label this point Kr)

Use Fig. 6.2 to determine the four-bit number produced by the ADC at time

State what is meant by electric potential at a point

A positively-charged particle is at rest on the surface of sphere A
The particle moves freely from the surface of sphere A to the surface of sphere B
1. Describe qualitatively the variation, if any, with distance \(x\) of the speed of the particle as it
moves from \(x = 12 \text{cm}\) to \(x = 25 \text{cm}\)
passes through \(x = 26 \text{cm}\)
moves from \(x = 27 \text{cm}\) to \(x = 31 \text{cm}\)
reaches \(x = 32 \text{cm}\)
The particle has charge \(3.2 \times 10^{-19} \text{C}\) and mass \(6.6 \times 10^{-27} \text{kg}\)
Calculate the maximum speed of the particle

where \(I\) is the current (in amperes) in the solenoid

Describe qualitatively the e.m.f. that is now induced in coil C

Use band theory to explain why

Calculate the thickness x

ratio = .........dB

Part of the beam passes normally through the metal of thickness \(3.2 \text{mm}\). Another part of the beam passes normally through the metal of thickness \(x \text{mm}\)
The linear attenuation (absorption) coefficient for the X-ray beam in the metal is \(1.5 \text{cm}^{-1}\)
The ratio

content.blockMath:
intensity of X-ray beam transmitted through \(3.2 \text{mm}\) of metal
intensity of X-ray beam transmitted through \(x \text{mm}\) of metal

content.text: is found to be 0.81
Define radioactive decay constant
Show that the decay constant \(\lambda\) is related to the half-life \(t_{\frac{1}{2}}\) of a radioactive isotope by the expression

A small volume of solution containing the radioactive isotope sodium-24 ( \(^{24}_{11}\mathrm {Na}\) ) has an initial activity of \(3.8\times 10^{4}\mathrm {Bq}\) . Sodium-24, of half-life 15 hours, decays to form a stable daughter isotope
All of the solution is poured into a container of water. After 36 hours, a sample of water of volume \(5.0 \text{cm}^3\) , taken from the container, is found to have an activity of \(1.2 \text{Bq}\)
Assuming that the solution of the radioactive isotope is distributed uniformly throughout the container of water, calculate the volume of water in the container
